content:
In order to understand the factors that influence the target behavior, it is also important to consider the role of incentives and rewards for adults 45 years old or older. Here are five examples of barriers related to incentives and rewards:

1. Lack of awareness or understanding of the incentives or rewards available for completing the questionnaire
2. Limited appeal or attractiveness of the incentives or rewards offered for completing the questionnaire
3. High or unrealistic requirements or criteria for receiving the incentives or rewards
4. Limited accessibility or availability of the incentives or rewards
5. Limited trust or confidence in the fairness or reliability of the incentives or rewards

By addressing these barriers, the company can develop an intervention that includes effective and appealing incentives and rewards for the target population. This can help to increase the motivation and engagement of the target population and ultimately increase the likelihood of success.
